StaticRange.summary: The DOM StaticRange interface extends to provide a method to specify a range of content in the DOM whose contents don't update to reflect changes which occur within the DOM tree.

remarks.para: This interface offers the same set of properties and methods as AbstractRange.
AbstractRange and StaticRange are not available from web workers.

-Live updating range of content within the DOM:
-, the abstract interface from which all ranges are derived

StaticRangeEndContainer.summary: The endContainer property of the interface returns the end for the range.
StaticRangeEndContainer.value: The DOM which contains the final character of the range.

StaticRangeStartContainer.summary:
The read-only startContainer
property of the interface returns the start
for the range.
StaticRangeStartContainer.value: The DOM inside which the start position of the range is found.

StaticRangeEndOffset.summary:
The endOffset property of the
interface returns the offset into the end node of the range's end position.
StaticRangeEndOffset.value:
An integer value indicating the number of characters into the
indicated by at which the final
character of the range is located.

StaticRangeCollapsed.summary:
The collapsed read-only property
of the interface returns true if the range's
start position and end position are the same.
StaticRangeCollapsed.value:
A boolean value which is true if the range
is collapsed. A collapsed range is one in which the start and end
positions are the same, resulting in a zero-character-long range.

StaticRangeStaticRange.summary:
The StaticRange() constructor
creates a new object representing a span of content within
the DOM.

remarks.para:
This constructor includes properties identifying the start and end positions of
the range as well as a Boolean indicating whether or not the range is
collapsed (that is, empty).

StaticRangeStaticRange.returns:
A new StaticRange object initialized with the values given in
the rangeSpec object.

StaticRangeStartOffset.summary:
The read-only startOffset
property of the interface returns the offset into the start
node of the range's start position.
StaticRangeStartOffset.value:
An integer value indicating the number of characters into the
indicated by at which the
first character of the range is located.
